quizDescription: Test your knowledge about the incomparable Diana Ross, her illustrious career, and her timeless music!
quizTags: Diana Ross, Motown, Music, R&B, Soul, The Supremes

questions.question: Diana Ross rose to fame as the lead singer of which iconic Motown group?
questions.explanation: Diana Ross rose to fame as the lead singer of The Supremes, one of Motown's most successful acts. The group achieved numerous chart-topping hits.

questions.question: What was Diana Ross' debut studio album as a solo artist, released in 1970?
questions.explanation: Diana Ross' debut studio album as a solo artist was titled 'Diana' and was released in 1970. It featured the hit singles 'Reach Out and Touch (Somebody's Hand)' and 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough.'

questions.question: Which Diana Ross song from the film 'Lady Sings the Blues' earned her an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress?
options: Theme from Mahogany (Do You Know Where You're Going To)
questions.answer: Theme from Mahogany (Do You Know Where You're Going To)
questions.explanation: The song 'Theme from Mahogany (Do You Know Where You're Going To)' from the film 'Lady Sings the Blues' earned Diana Ross an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress.

questions.question: Diana Ross' duet 'Endless Love' with Lionel Richie became a massive hit in which year?
questions.explanation: Diana Ross' duet 'Endless Love' with Lionel Richie became a massive hit in 1981. The song topped the charts and became one of her most celebrated collaborations.

questions.question: Which Diana Ross song includes the lyrics: 'Upside down, you're turning me, you're giving love instinctively'?
questions.explanation: The song 'Upside Down' includes the lyrics: 'Upside down, you're turning me, you're giving love instinctively.' It was a chart-topping hit for Diana Ross.

questions.question: What was the title of Diana Ross' first solo single released after leaving The Supremes?
options: Theme from Mahogany (Do You Know Where You're Going To)
questions.explanation: Diana Ross' first solo single released after leaving The Supremes was 'Reach Out and Touch (Somebody's Hand).' The song encouraged unity and reaching out to others.

questions.question: Diana Ross achieved her first number one hit as a solo artist with which song?
questions.explanation: Diana Ross achieved her first number one hit as a solo artist with the song 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough.' The song became a defining moment in her solo career.

questions.question: In 1983, Diana Ross performed during a halftime show at the Super Bowl. Which team won that Super Bowl?
questions.explanation: In 1983, Diana Ross performed during a halftime show at the Super Bowl XVII. The Washington Redskins won that Super Bowl, defeating the Miami Dolphins.

questions.question: Diana Ross received the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award in which year?
questions.explanation: Diana Ross received the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award in 2012. The award recognized her exceptional contributions to the music industry and her enduring impact as an artist.

questions.question: Which prestigious award did Diana Ross receive in 2007, honoring her outstanding career achievements?
questions.explanation: Diana Ross received The Kennedy Center Honor in 2007, recognizing her contributions to American culture through the performing arts.
